0.title: DIET & EXERCISE BOOKS
clues: Learn how to "Master Your Metabolism" from Jillian Michaels, one of the trainers on this NBC show
Brooke Siler's guide to this fitness method teaches "Strengthening, Lengthening, & Toning... Without Machines"
Florida doctor Arthur Agatston's book for this diet includes chapters on "Good Carbs, Bad Carbs" & "Good Fats, Bad Fats"
In 1978, 6 years before his death while running, his "Complete Book of Running" ran up the bestseller list
DAILY DOUBLE
In Elisabeth Hasselbeck's "The G Free Diet", the G is this protein that some people can't tolerate

1.title: FILLING FOODS
clues: Hard-boiled ____ foo yong
Jerk ____-fried steak
Navel ____ roughy
Dijon ____ greens
Mint ____ roll

2.title: WOMEN'S GROUPS
clues: Constitution Hall in Washington, D.C. is part of a 3-building complex owned & operated by this lineage society
In the 1980s this organization created the Daisies for young ladies 5 years old or in kindergarten
In 2005 Glynn Birch became the first male president of this women's group founded by Candy Lightner
Elizabeth Dole & Katie Couric were members of this sorority whose name is 3 of the same Greek letter
To join the group called his Daughters, girls must be between the ages of 10 & 20 & be related to a Master Mason

3.title: STATES' MOST POPULOUS CITIES
clues: Pennsylvania
Oregon
Texas
Tennessee
New Jersey

4.title: THE WIZARD
clues: In "Lord of the Rings", this wizard grapples with a nasty balrog in the mines of Moria
A wizard named Akiro is one of this title barbarian's companions in 2 1980s movies
Michael Jackson was the scarecrow & Diana Ross was Dorothy in the big screen version of this Broadway hit
Selena Gomez has magical powers on TV's "Wizards of" here & sings "Magic" on the soundtrack CD
Nicol Williamson played Merlin in this magical 1981 film

5.title: OF "OZ"
clues: A famous red-coiffed clown, or just any incompetent fool
Adjective often preceding "daiquiri"
A type of large tractor
Cough relief often comes as this small, medicated candy
The name of these single-celled organisms is from the Greek for "first animals"

6.title: 19th CENTURY AFRICA
clues: Muhammad Ali, an officer in this empire's army, drove the French out of Egypt in 1801 & became the country's ruler
In 1887 Ethiopia's Menelik II founded this city in the Entoto Mountains
In 1859 Spain attacked this country over possession of Ceuta, a city on the Strait of Gibraltar
In August 1826 Gordon Laing became the first European to set foot in this Mali trading post
In 1888 this son of a British clergyman founded the De Beers mining company

7.title: THE NFL
clues: In 1984, his second year in the league, this Dolphin QB became the first to throw for 5,000 yards in a single season
Members of the NFL in 1922 & '23, the all-Native American Oorang Indians were led by this legend
On Dec. 13, 2009 Brandon Marshall of this team set a one-game record with 21 receptions--in a loss to the Colts
New Orleans Saints kicker Tom Dempsey's record 63-yard field goal was kicked in this school's stadium
DAILY DOUBLE
When a team switched cities in 1988, this new full team name contained 2 birds, one real & one mythic

8.title: PLAY TIME
clues: Plays about driving include Paula Vogel's "How I Learned to Drive" & this Alfred Uhry work
DAILY DOUBLE
There's only 1 character in "The Belle of Amherst" & it's her
The dialog for "Are You Now or Have You Ever Been?" was drawn from the hearings of this committee during the 1950s
This 1955 play was based on the Scopes Monkey Trial of 1925
In 2008 Mike Nichols directed a Broadway revival of this playwright's "The Country Girl"

9.title: FLORAL PATTERNS
clues: "Gilding" this flower means adding unnecessary ornamentation
If someone calls you a "shrinking" one of these, it doesn't mean you're getting smaller, it means you're shy
Taking this flower's "path" seems easy at first, but could end in tragedy
"Everything's" doing this, a phrase about emerging from hard times in good shape, is a "Gypsy" song title
"What's The Story" this A.M. opener with 20-foot vines

10.title: BIBLICAL MEGADEATHS
clues: This judge didn't need his hotel Bible when he & his men killed 120,000 Midianites
This biblical book with a female name records the killing of 75,000 Persians by the Jews
The Lord himself slew 50,070 "raiders" of Beth Shemesh for looking into this holy object
During the time of Samuel, the Israelites lost 30,000 soldiers fighting this neighboring group
II Kings recounts the slaughter by an angel of the Lord of 185,000 soldiers of this kingdom to the north of Israel

11.title: DAMAGES
clues: (Glenn Close reads the clue from a chair on the set of Damages.)  Patty's lawsuit against Arthur Frobisher is this type in which 1 plaintiff or 1 defendant represents a group with similar interests
(Glenn Close reads the clue from a chair on the set of Damages.)  Civil suits are often resolved by signing this type of out-of-court agreement; that's fine if you're afraid of a fight
(Glenn Close reads the clue from a chair on the set of Damages.)  The legal term embracery usually means tampering with or trying to influence this group--who would do that?

(Glenn Close reads the clue from a chair on the set of Damages.)  Damages awarded by a court can be compensatory, to make up for a loss, or this type, in which society is letting you know you did very wrong

(Glenn Close reads the clue from a chair on the set of Damages.)  This plural noun refers to a judge's office, where a case can be discussed & his honor may be brought around to the right way of thinking
